subclass.name: Path of the Masked Scourge
subclassFeatures: Path of the Masked Scourge|Barbarian||Masked Scourge|PotMS|3

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Masked Scourge

entries: It came at me, horns protruding from its head, a giant, inhuman grin fixed on its face and eyes like fires that bore into my soul. Some have claimed to me that it was just a man in a mask, but I know this can't be true. They don't know. They didn't stare into those eyes and see their own death staring back at them...
{@b A PRIMAL PATH}

Some barbarians learn how to craft strange and terrifying masks to aid them both on and off the battlefield. These masks are magical and unique, and the key to their creation is a carefully guarded secret.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Maskmaker
entries: When you choose this primal path at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with the {@item disguise kit|phb} and your choice of either {@item leatherworker's tools|phb|leatherworker's}, {@item smith's tools|phb|smith's} or {@item woodcarver's tools|phb|woodworker's tools}.

subclassFeature.name: Masked Rage
entries: Also at 3rd level, you learn how to craft masks and imbue them with magic. You learn how to make 2 masks from the {@filter Masks of Fury|optionalfeatures|feature type=PotMS:MoF} list at the end of this subclass. You learn how to make additional masks when you gain certain levels in this class, as shown in the mask table. You choose the physical appearance of these masks.

You may spend 10 minutes crafting a mask you know how to make, and may do so as part of taking a short or long rest. Whenever you craft two masks of the same type, the mask you crafted first turns to dust. These masks only effect you, on any other creature they are normal masks. If a mask requires a saving throw, the DC is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier.
You may don or doff one mask before going into a rage (as part of the same action), or as a bonus action on your turn.
Some of your masks makes use of your Mask die, which is a {@dice d6} and increases in size when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the mask table.

subclassFeature.name: Masks of Fury
entries: If a mask of fury has prerequisites, you must meet them to learn to make it. You can learn how to make a mask at the same time that you meet its prerequisites. A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class.

entries.name: Mask of Death (6th level or higher)
Mask of the Poisoner (6th level or higher)
Mask of the Shadow (6th level or higher)

subclassFeature.name: Skills of the Scourge
entries: At 6th level, your skills are heightened. Whenever you fail a skill check that you are proficient in, you may add one roll of your Mask die to the roll, potentially causing the check to succeed.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, after which you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Nightmarish Visage
entries: At 10th level, your masks can truly terrify. While you are raging and wearing a mask, once during each of your turns, when you hit a creature with an attack, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier, and if the saving throw fails, the target is {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Masks
entries: At 14th level, your masks grant you additional abilities. Whenever you don a mask, you may choose to gain one of the following benefits for as long as you are wearing that mask:

items: Your gain resistance to one damage type of your choice between acid, cold, fire, lightning and thunder damage.
Your speed increases by 5 feet, and you gain a flying speed equal to half your walking speed (rounded down to the nearest multiple of 5).
You may add your mask die to the first weapon attack you make each turn.

optionalfeature.name: Mask of the Avenger
entries: As long as you are wearing this mask, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}. When you enter into a rage while wearing this mask or don it while you are raging, you may choose a creature you can see within 90 feet of you. While you are still raging, the first time you hit the chosen creature with a weapon attack on each of your turns, the attack deals additional damage equal to one roll of your Mask die. After you deal damage to a creature this way, that target has disadvantage on any attack roll that isn't against you until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Mask of the Defiler
entries: As long as you are wearing this mask, you have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks you make. While you are raging and wearing this mask, as a bonus action you can choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The chosen creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or take necrotic damage equal to one roll of your Mask die and be unable to regain hitpoints until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Mask of the Destroyer
entries: As long as you are wearing this mask, your carrying capacity (including maximum load and maximum lift) is doubled, and you have advantage on Strength checks made to push, pull, lift, or break objects. While you are raging and wearing this mask, as a bonus action you can choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take fire damage equal to one roll of your Mask die. Any flammable objects that are not being worn or carried within 5 feet of the target catch fire.

optionalfeature.name: Mask of the Guardian
entries: As long as you are wearing this mask, when a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. While you are raging and wearing this mask, as a bonus action you may choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. That creature gains temporary hitpoints equal to one roll of your Mask die until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Mask of Light
entries: As long as you are wearing this mask, your mask sheds dim light in a 15 foot radius around you. While you are raging and wearing this mask, the light created by your mask becomes bright light and it sheds dim light for an additional 15 feet, and whenever a creature you can see within 15 feet of you is dealt damage by another creature, as a reaction you may cause the target to take extra radiant damage equal to one roll of your Mask die.

optionalfeature.name: Mask of Death
entries: As long as you are wearing this mask, you have advantage on death saving throws. Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hitpoints while raging and wearing this mask, you gain temporary hitpoints equal to two rolls of your Mask die.

optionalfeature.name: Mask of the Poisoner
entries: As long as you are wearing this mask, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance against poison damage. While you are raging and wearing this mask, the first creature you hit on each of your turns with a weapon attack takes extra poison damage equal to one roll of your mask die, and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Mask of the Shadow
entries: As long as you are wearing this mask, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks you make and have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. While you are raging and wearing this mask, you may take the {@action Disengage} and {@action Hide} actions as a bonus action.
